<a id="AudioListener3D"></a>

# AudioListener3D

**Inherits:** [Node3D](Node3D.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Overrides the location sounds are heard from.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Once added to the scene tree and enabled using [make_current()](AudioListener3D.md#AudioListener3D_method_make_current), this node will override the location sounds are heard from. This can be used to listen from a location different from the [Camera3D](Camera3D.md).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_AudioListener3D_DopplerTracking"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **DopplerTracking**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_AudioListener3D_DopplerTracking)

<a id="AudioListener3D_constant_DOPPLER_TRACKING_DISABLED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[DopplerTracking](AudioListener3D.md#enum_AudioListener3D_DopplerTracking) **DOPPLER_TRACKING_DISABLED** = `0`

Disables [Doppler effect](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doppler_effect) simulation (default).<a id="AudioListener3D_constant_DOPPLER_TRACKING_IDLE_STEP"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[DopplerTracking](AudioListener3D.md#enum_AudioListener3D_DopplerTracking) **DOPPLER_TRACKING_IDLE_STEP** = `1`

Simulate [Doppler effect](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doppler_effect) by tracking positions of objects that are changed in ``_process``. Changes in the relative velocity of this listener compared to those objects affect how audio is perceived (changing the audio's [AudioStreamPlayer3D.pitch_scale](AudioStreamPlayer3D.md#AudioStreamPlayer3D_property_pitch_scale)).<a id="AudioListener3D_constant_DOPPLER_TRACKING_PHYSICS_STEP"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[DopplerTracking](AudioListener3D.md#enum_AudioListener3D_DopplerTracking) **DOPPLER_TRACKING_PHYSICS_STEP** = `2`

Simulate [Doppler effect](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doppler_effect) by tracking positions of objects that are changed in ``_physics_process``. Changes in the relative velocity of this listener compared to those objects affect how audio is perceived (changing the audio's [AudioStreamPlayer3D.pitch_scale](AudioStreamPlayer3D.md#AudioStreamPlayer3D_property_pitch_scale)).<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="AudioListener3D_property_doppler_tracking"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[DopplerTracking](AudioListener3D.md#enum_AudioListener3D_DopplerTracking) **doppler_tracking** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#AudioListener3D_property_doppler_tracking)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_doppler_tracking**\ (\ value\: [DopplerTracking](AudioListener3D.md#enum_AudioListener3D_DopplerTracking)\ )
- [DopplerTracking](AudioListener3D.md#enum_AudioListener3D_DopplerTracking) **get_doppler_tracking**\ (\ )

If not [DOPPLER_TRACKING_DISABLED](AudioListener3D.md#AudioListener3D_constant_DOPPLER_TRACKING_DISABLED), this listener will simulate the [Doppler effect](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doppler_effect) for objects changed in particular ``_process`` methods.

\ **Note:** The Doppler effect will only be heard on [AudioStreamPlayer3D](AudioStreamPlayer3D.md)\\ s if [AudioStreamPlayer3D.doppler_tracking](AudioStreamPlayer3D.md#AudioStreamPlayer3D_property_doppler_tracking) is not set to [AudioStreamPlayer3D.DOPPLER_TRACKING_DISABLED](AudioStreamPlayer3D.md#AudioStreamPlayer3D_constant_DOPPLER_TRACKING_DISABLED).

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="AudioListener3D_method_clear_current"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **clear_current**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AudioListener3D_method_clear_current)

Disables the listener to use the current camera's listener instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AudioListener3D_method_get_listener_transform"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Transform3D](Transform3D.md) **get_listener_transform**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#AudioListener3D_method_get_listener_transform)

Returns the listener's global orthonormalized [Transform3D](Transform3D.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AudioListener3D_method_is_current"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_current**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#AudioListener3D_method_is_current)

Returns ``true`` if the listener was made current using [make_current()](AudioListener3D.md#AudioListener3D_method_make_current), ``false`` otherwise.

\ **Note:** There may be more than one AudioListener3D marked as "current" in the scene tree, but only the one that was made current last will be used.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="AudioListener3D_method_make_current"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **make_current**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#AudioListener3D_method_make_current)

Enables the listener. This will override the current camera's listener.
